business.headline: ICICI Bank cuts minimum balance after backlash. Check new rules and penaltiesThe bank's decision comes after strong public criticism, particularly over the earlier increase in urban and metro monthly average balance levels.
JSW Cement shares list at 4% premium on stock market debut On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 153, up 4.1%, while on the NSE they began trading at Rs 153.50, a gain of 4.4%.

Muthoot Finance shares jump 10% to hit record high after Q1 results. Should you buy?The gold loan financing company has seen its stock lifted by strong quarterly performance, rising investor confidence, and positive brokerage recommendations. Shares of the company were trading 10.43% higher at Rs 2,772.55 on the BSE at 10:04 am.
Bitcoin surges past $124,000 to hit all-time high. What's fueling the rally?Bitcoin hit an all-time high of $124,000. Here's why Bitcoin surged past $124K and will it keep climbing?

Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally; Infosys, Wipro among top gainersThe S&P BSE Sensex opened more than 100 points higher and was trading 51.75 points up at 80,591.66 around 9:25 am. The NSE Nifty50 rose 13.80 points to 24,633.15.

Gujarat's textile industry threatened by 50% US tariffs demands 10% export incentiveIndia's total textile exports to the US are valued at USD 10–12 billion annually, with Gujarat accounting for more than 15 per cent of that trade.

Mumbai regulatory body acts against Palais Royale developer over Rs 100 crore duesMahaRERA's adjudicating officer has now issued recovery warrants under Section 40(1) of the RERA Act, enabling the District Collector to recover the amount as arrears of land revenue.

US tariff impact will be temporary, private sector should step up: Chief economistChief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran attributed the growth slowdown in FY25, which saw a deceleration to 6.5 per cent from FY24's 9.2 per cent, to tight credit conditions and liquidity issues.

ICICI Bank lowers minimum balance for savings accounts after outrageThe new minimum average balance thresholds are as follows: Rs 15,000 for customers in metro and urban areas, Rs 7,500 for semi-urban customers, and Rs 2,500 for those in rural locations.

5 credit score myths you should stop believingYour credit score can open doors to better loans and credit cards, or shut them. Yet, many people still rely on half-truths and hearsay. Let's separate fact from fiction.

Sebi eases rules for foreign investors: Here's all you need to knowSebi plans to introduce simpler rules to make it easier for foreign investors to enter India's markets. The move aims to cut compliance burdens and attract more long-term overseas capital.

Indians sent abroad enough money in a decade to build 62 IITs, says RBI dataIn 2023–24 alone, students remitted about Rs 29,000 crore abroad for their studies, almost the same as the previous year. A decade ago, this figure was just Rs 2,429 crore.

entertainment.headline: War 2 X review: Hrithik and Jr NTR's action thrills, but story sparks debate'War 2', starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, sparks mixed reactions. Praised for its action and visuals, but criticised for plot and VFX. Fans are divided.

Shilpa Shirodkar's car hit by bus, slams transport firm for shirking responsibilityActor Shilpa Shirodkar's car was struck by a Cityflo bus in Mumbai on Wednesday. The bus company denied liability despite police assistance in filing a complaint.

Taylor Swift unveils Life of a Showgirl album, cover, and featuresPop sensation Taylor Swift shares details for her 12th studio album 'The Life of a Showgirl'. The former Eras tourmates will team up on the LP's title track.

Coolie X review: Rajinikanth's energy and Nagarjuna's charm win fans overRajinikanth's 'Coolie' released in theatres today, and fans are in the mood to celebrate. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the theatres have turned into a carnival with fans rejoicing and dancing.

Steve trailer: Cillian Murphy as headmaster fights his inner demons at reform schoolNetflix has released the official trailer for Steve, a drama starring Cillian Murphy as a headteacher fighting to save his reform school. The film explores deep mental health issues amid institutional challenges in the 1990s England.

Antony Starr shares farewell note ahead of final season of The BoysActor Antony Starr bid farewell to his role as Homelander in 'The Boys' in a heartfelt Instagram. He said the role helped him grow personally and creatively. The fifth and final season of 'The Boys' will be released in 2026.

Vivek Agnihotri's The Bengal Files trailer to be attached with War 2 and CoolieThe trailer for director Vivek Agnihotri's upcoming film 'The Bengal Files: Right to Life' will be attached to 'War 2' and 'Coolie'. Here's what we know.

Hrithik, Jr NTR urge fans to let War 2 be a secret to everyone: Spoilers are no funHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR appealed to fans to keep 'War 2' spoilers under wraps ahead of the film's release. Their request aims to preserve the film's thrilling experience for all viewers.

Atif Aslam mourns father Muhammad Aslam's death: Final goodbye to my Iron manIn an emotional post, Pakistani singer Atif Aslam shared the news of his father Muhammad Aslam's death on Tuesday. His father, aged 77, died of health complications. Atif Aslam has sung several hit songs for both Pakistani and Indian films.

Uttar Pradesh government praises Mahavatar Narsimha for cultural revivalThe Uttar Pradesh government applauded 'Mahavatar Narsimha' for its cultural impact on Wednesday. Despite having a slow start, the film performed well at the global box office due to positive word of mouth.

Niyati Joshi exits Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai after 6 years: Nothing lasts foreverNiyati Joshi has bid an emotional goodbye to her role in Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai after six years. Her departure marks the end of a memorable chapter for fans and the show alike.

Get those muscles: Bipasha Basu shares cyptic post after viral Mrunal Thakur clipBipasha Basu shared an empowering Instagram story urging women to build strength. Her message challenges outdated views on women's physical power following Mrunal Thakur's body-shaming video.

Aamir Khan-Rajinikanth's old clip from Aatank Hi Aatank goes viral ahead of CoolieA clip from the 1995 film 'Aatank Hi Aatank' featuring actors Aamir Khan and Rajinikanth has gone viral. The film garnered the attention of social media users a day before the release of their much-anticipated film 'Coolie'.

Film body seeks clarification from Badshah over Dallas event by Pakistani companyFWICE has written to Badshah seeking clarification on his Dallas concert sponsored by a Pakistani company. The move highlights tensions over cross-border collaborations amid rising national security concerns.

Task trailer: Mark Ruffalo races against time to catch suspicious criminalHBO's crime drama Task starring Mark Ruffalo will premiere on 7 September 2025. The series explores a tense moral clash within a family-led crime investigation in Philadelphia.

Mukesh Khanna questions Ranbir Kapoor's casting as Lord Rama in RamayanaActor Mukesh Khanna recently shared his views on the casting of the lead role in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. He voiced his reservations about whether Ranbir Kapoor would be able to convincingly portray Lord Rama's 'Maryada Purushottam' image.
Richa Chadha says motherhood has calmed her rebel spiritActor Richa Chadha shared that since becoming a mother she speaks more gently and has grown more patient.

Exclusive: Priyanshu Painyulli wants a spin-off for Robin's character in MirzapurActor Priyanshu Painyulli, in an interview with India Today, expressed that his character Robin in 'Mirzapur' should have a spin-off. He also expressed how the character changed him and if he would be a part of the film based on the series.

West Bengal orders daily prime time Bengali films in all cinemasWest Bengal government has made it compulsory for all cinema halls to screen Bengali films daily during prime time. This move aims to boost regional cinema.

general news.headline: Stray dogs hearing live: Children unable to go out to play, government saysThe Supreme Court on Wednesday shifted the suo motu case regarding stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to a newly constituted three-judge bench, which will hear the matter today. The case, earlier being heard by a different bench, will now be taken up by a special bench comprising Justices Vikram Nath, Sandeep Mehta, and NV Anjaria. The bench will hear the four pleas listed before it.
High Court's 'perverse' bail to actor Darshan in murder case cancelled by top courtPerverse and wholly unwarranted: Supreme Court cancels bail to actor Darshan in Renukaswamy murder case

Heavy rain batters Delhi-NCR, more showers may dampen long weekend plansDelhi-NCR rain: Severe waterlogging choked key stretches across Delhi and left several underpasses flooded ahead of Independence Day celebrations.

A demand for national meat sale calendar amid non-veg row in MaharashtraThe Poultry Federation of India has urged the Union Minister to introduce a meat sales calendar to avoid disputes and financial losses from meat bans during religious festivals and holidays.

Coolie X review: Rajinikanth's energy and Nagarjuna's charm win fans overRajinikanth's 'Coolie' released in theatres today, and fans are in the mood to celebrate. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the theatres have turned into a carnival with fans rejoicing and dancing.

Trump warns Russia of very severe consequences if Putin blocks Ukraine dealThe US President's warning comes after a high-level virtual call between Trump, Zelenskyy, and European leaders, hosted by Germany, to outline non-negotiable positions ahead of the Alaska talks.

Case against Shilpa Shetty, husband for cheating businessman of Rs 60 croreThe case against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra was filed by businessman Deepak Kothari, who alleged that the couple conspired to defraud him of Rs 60 crore.

Will this drug end baldness forever?PP405 is a new topical drug that targets the root cause of hair loss and reactivates dormant follicles. Its success could change hair loss treatment in India but awaits further clinical trials.

I am a doctor and this is the single worst thing you can do to your liverOur liver doesn't get the respect it deserves. As unhealthy lifestyles rise, here's the single most harmful habit that can damage the second-largest organ in the body.

How India's US-dependent diamond industry shrivels under Trump tariffsThe United States—India's largest market for gems and jewellery—accounts for over $10 billion in exports, nearly 30 per cent of the industry's total global trade

How developing brain in teens plays key role in consent for sexThe government has argued against reducing the age of consent for sex from 18 to 16. While there are legal arguments, neuroscience shows how a developing brain is wired for risk-taking and impulsive behaviour. How does this understanding of the brain tally with the age of consent debate?

From prawns, mutton to fish: Non-vegetarian prasad traditions across IndiaAditya Thackeray recently mentioned that in some communities, prawns and fish are offered as 'prasad' during Navratri, illustrating how offerings can differ across regions and traditions.

Fencing sisters Jyotika and Rishika turn grit and guts into global recognitionFencers Jyotika Dutta and Rishika Khajuria have turned hard work and persistence into results. Their Under Armour deal is a milestone, showing that Indian fencing has talent, promise, and a brighter future.

Adoption rules, welfare safeguards: 10 takeaways from order on stray dogsOn August 11, the Supreme Court directed civic bodies to remove all stray dogs from Delhi-NCR within eight weeks. A detailed 19-page order was published later. Here are the key takeaways.

E20 fuel in India: Your key questions answeredIndia's nationwide rollout of E20 fuel promises cleaner mobility and economic gains, but for older vehicles, it could mean reduced mileage, higher maintenance, and potential long-term wear and tear.

Injured elephant storms Guwahati street, smashes parked car. Watch viral videoAn injured elephant stormed a roadside in Guwahati and smashed a parked car as residents watched. A video of the incident has gone viral.
Bitcoin surges past $124,000 to hit all-time high. What's fueling the rally?Bitcoin hit an all-time high of $124,000. Here's why Bitcoin surged past $124K and will it keep climbing?

Arjun Tendulkar gets engaged to hotelier Ravi Ghai's granddaughter Saaniya ChandokLegendary Indian batter Sachin Tendulkar's son, Arjun Tendulkar, has been engaged to Saaniya Chandok, the granddaughter of prominent Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai.

War 2 Review and Release Live: Hrithik, Jr NTR film draws mixed fan reactionsWar 2 Release & Review Live Updates: The wait is finally over as Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's highly anticipated action spectacle 'War 2' is set to roar into cinemas today. The latest chapter in YRF's Spy Universe has sparked celebrations across the country, with fans eager to witness the high-octane showdown. Directed by Ayan Mukerji, the film also features Kiara Advani in a pivotal role.

Salt and sugar for babies? Grandma's all for both, science isn'tEven though doctors strongly advise no sugar and no salt for infants, many elderly caregivers find it hard to accept. But real care isn't about sticking to old habits, it's about understanding what's truly best for the baby.

Coolie Review and Release Live Update: Anirudh, Lokesh Kanagaraj watch film with fansCoolie Movie Release, Review Live Updates: Rajinikanth's highly anticipated film 'Coolie' released in theatres on August 14. As early shows began in the South, celebrations began with excited fans storming theatres to watch the veteran actor on the big screen.

sports.headline: OTD: Sachin Tendulkar hits maiden international hundred at age of 17In August 1990, a 17-year-old Sachin Tendulkar announced his arrival against a daunting English side. He scored his first Test hundred in his 9th red-ball game for India.

Vece Paes, Olympian and father of tennis great Leander Paes dies at 80Dr Vece Paes, a former hockey player who won an Olympic medal in 1972, has died at the age of 80. Paes is also father to legendary tennis player Leander Paes.

PSG players celebrate special comeback after thrilling Super Cup win vs TottenhamParis Saint-Germain staged a late comeback to beat Tottenham Hotspur in the UEFA Super Cup final. The dramatic penalty shootout victory marks a historic first Super Cup win for the French club.

When R Ashwin nearly got scammed into giving away Virat Kohli's phone numberRavichandran Ashwin narrowly avoided a scammer posing as Devon Conway. The scammer was asking for Virat Kohli's phone number after IPL 2025.

Fencing sisters Jyotika and Rishika turn grit and guts into global recognitionFencers Jyotika Dutta and Rishika Khajuria have turned hard work and persistence into results. Their Under Armour deal is a milestone, showing that Indian fencing has talent, promise, and a brighter future.

Drop Babar Azam. But does it guarantee a Pakistan turnaround in ODIs?PAK vs WI: Babar Azam's poor form is a big concern, with his struggles continuing in recent matches. However, despite his current slump, he's still Pakistan's best option in the middle order, and replacing him could cause more problems for the team.

Chennai Grand Masters: Karthikeyan beats Vidit, Keymer closes in on titleGrandmaster M Karthikeyan kept his hopes alive in the Chennai Grand Masters with a hard-fought win over compatriot Vidit Gujrathi in Round 7, while Germany's Vincent Keymer tightened his grip on the title race. With only two rounds remaining, Keymer leads by 1.5 points and could clinch the crown in the next round.

Timing of verdict on Man City's 115 charges out of our hands: Premier League CEOPremier League chief executive Richard Masters on Wednesday defended the league's judicial process, responding to criticism over the slow progress in Manchester City's disciplinary case involving 115 alleged breaches of financial regulations.

Rishabh Pant shares photo of his fractured foot in a cast: I hate thisRishabh Pant has expressed his frustration over a plastered left foot, sharing a photo of it on his Instagram stories on Wednesday. He sustained the injury on the opening day of the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford.

FC Goa return to AFC Champions League 2 with 2-1 win over Al SeebFC Goa beat Al Seeb 2-1 to reach the AFC Champions League Two group stage for the first time since 2021. Dejan Drazic and debutant Javier Siverio struck as the Gaurs held firm to secure a historic continental return.

However, despite his current slump, he's still Pakistan's best option in the middle order, and replacing him could cause more problems for the team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
